result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J Miller

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler J Miller in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Tyler J Miller.
State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Rockow relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Court costs - 60 DTP
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Court advises firearm will be destroyed.

2:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler J Miller in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Tyler J Miller. 
Attorney Rockow requests plea hearing. Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:54 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyler J Miller in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Tyler J Miller. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and enters NG plea.
Hearing set.
Bond to continue.
Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:06 PM Defendant Tyler J Miller appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Tyler J Miller for today. Still needs to apply,  Must contact the public defender office before leaving the jail.  
Address and Telephone # confirmed.
